title: Anglesey Family Adventure
tagline: Island adventures for all the family
suitableFor: Families with children aged 8 and up who enjoy outdoor activities and are comfortable with easy physical exertion. Also suitable for active grandparents.
notSuitableFor: Those with limited mobility or a strong aversion to water activities. Very young children (under 5) may find some activities challenging.

stops.title: Sea Kayaking with Anglesey Adventures
stops.description: Explore the Anglesey coastline from the sea in a guided kayaking tour. Suitable for all levels, with options for shorter or longer paddles.

wetAlt.title: Anglesey Transport Museum
wetAlt.description: Discover vintage cars, motorcycles, and other vehicles at this fascinating museum.

budgetAlt.title: Beach Exploration at Rhosneigr
budgetAlt.description: Spend the morning building sandcastles and exploring the rock pools at Rhosneigr Beach.

stops.title: The Oyster Catcher
stops.description: A relaxed gastropub with stunning sea views and a menu featuring local seafood and pub classics.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Rhosneigr Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic lunch with views of the beach.

stops.title: Coastal Walk to Porth Trecastell (Cable Bay)
stops.description: Take a scenic coastal walk from Rhosneigr to Porth Trecastell, a beautiful sandy beach known for its surfing. Enjoy the views and keep an eye out for wildlife.

wetAlt.title: Oriel Mon
wetAlt.description: Explore the history and art of Anglesey at this museum and gallery.

budgetAlt.title: Relax on Rhosneigr Beach
budgetAlt.description: Spend the afternoon relaxing on the sand and enjoying the sea breeze.

stops.title: Surf's Edge Apartment
stops.description: A comfortable and well-equipped self-catering apartment in the heart of Rhosneigr, perfect for families.

budgetAlt.title: Rhosneigr Bunkhouse
budgetAlt.description: A budget-friendly bunkhouse offering basic accommodation for travellers.

stops.title: Puffin Island Boat Trip from Beaumaris
stops.description: Take a boat trip to Puffin Island to observe the puffins and other seabirds in their natural habitat. Booking essential.

wetAlt.title: Beaumaris Castle
wetAlt.description: Explore the impressive ruins of this unfinished medieval castle.

budgetAlt.title: Walk along Beaumaris Pier
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy views of the Menai Strait and Puffin Island from Beaumaris Pier.

stops.title: Trearddur Bay Beach Day
stops.description: Spend the morning at Trearddur Bay. Relax on the beach, swim in the sea, or enjoy a picnic.

wetAlt.title: Holyhead Maritime Museum
wetAlt.description: Discover the maritime history of Holyhead at this museum.

budgetAlt.title: Rockpooling at Trearddur Bay
budgetAlt.description: Explore the rock pools at low tide and discover marine life.

stops.title: Sea Shanty Cafe
stops.description: A casual cafe serving light lunches, snacks, and drinks with sea views.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Trearddur Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic lunch overlooking the bay.

stops.title: South Stack RSPB Reserve
stops.description: Visit South Stack, a dramatic coastal headland and RSPB reserve. Walk to the lighthouse and look out for seabirds and seals. Be aware it's a steep walk down to the lighthouse.

wetAlt.title: Ellin's Tower Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Learn about the wildlife of South Stack at this visitor centre.

budgetAlt.title: Coastal walk along South Stack cliffs
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a free walk along the cliff tops with stunning views.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Anglesey weather can be unpredictable, even in summer. Pack layers and be prepared for rain. Sea conditions can also change quickly, so pay attention to local forecasts before water activities.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy in Anglesey during peak season, especially around popular tourist spots like Beaumaris and Trearddur Bay. Arrive early to secure parking, particularly at South Stack. The A55 can get congested.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Boat trips to Puffin Island and kayaking tours should be booked in advance, especially during the summer months. Accommodation also fills up quickly, so book early to avoid disappointment.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary involves some walking and light physical activity. A reasonable level of fitness is required. South Stack involves some steep steps.
